trans-unit.source: Different ways to create a Windows virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Different ways to create a Windows virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Lists the different ways to create a Windows virtual machine and gives links to instructions.
trans-unit.target: Lists the different ways to create a Windows virtual machine and gives links to instructions.

trans-unit.source: Different ways to create a Windows virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Different ways to create a Windows virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Azure offers different ways to create a virtual machine because virtual machines are suited for different users and purposes.
trans-unit.target: Azure offers different ways to create a virtual machine because virtual machines are suited for different users and purposes.

trans-unit.source: This means that you need to make some choices about the virtual machine and how to create it.
trans-unit.target: This means that you need to make some choices about the virtual machine and how to create it.

trans-unit.source: This article gives you a summary of these choices and links to instructions.
trans-unit.target: This article gives you a summary of these choices and links to instructions.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates were recently introduced as a way to create and manage a virtual machine and its different resources as one logical deployment unit.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates were recently introduced as a way to create and manage a virtual machine and its different resources as one logical deployment unit.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for this approach are included below, where available.
trans-unit.target: Instructions for this approach are included below, where available.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager and how to manage resources as one unit, see the [Overview][].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager and how to manage resources as one unit, see the [Overview][].

trans-unit.source: Tool choices
trans-unit.target: Tool choices

trans-unit.source: GUI: The Azure portal or Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: GUI: The Azure portal or Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: The graphical user interface of the Azure portal is an easy way to try out a virtual machine, especially if you're just starting out with Azure.
trans-unit.target: The graphical user interface of the Azure portal is an easy way to try out a virtual machine, especially if you're just starting out with Azure.

trans-unit.source: Use either the Azure portal or the Azure preview portal to create the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: Use either the Azure portal or the Azure preview portal to create the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: [Create a virtual machine running Windows][]
trans-unit.target: [Create a virtual machine running Windows][]

trans-unit.source: Command shell: Azure CLI or Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Command shell: Azure CLI or Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: If you prefer working in a command shell, choose between the Azure command-line interface (CLI) for Mac and Linux users, or Azure PowerShell, which has Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Azure and a custom console.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer working in a command shell, choose between the Azure command-line interface (CLI) for Mac and Linux users, or Azure PowerShell, which has Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Azure and a custom console.

trans-unit.source: For Azure CLI, see [Equivalent Resource Manager and Service Management commands for virtual machine operations with the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows][].
trans-unit.target: For Azure CLI, see [Equivalent Resource Manager and Service Management commands for virtual machine operations with the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows][].

trans-unit.source: To use a template, see [Deploy and manage virtual machines using Azure Resource Manager templates and the Azure CLI][].
trans-unit.target: To use a template, see [Deploy and manage virtual machines using Azure Resource Manager templates and the Azure CLI][].

trans-unit.source: For Azure PowerShell, see [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows virtual machines][] To use a template, see [Deploy and manage virtual machines using Azure Resource Manager templates and PowerShell][].
trans-unit.target: For Azure PowerShell, see [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows virtual machines][] To use a template, see [Deploy and manage virtual machines using Azure Resource Manager templates and PowerShell][].

trans-unit.source: To create virtual machines in the Service Management stack, see [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows virtual machines][].
trans-unit.target: To create virtual machines in the Service Management stack, see [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows virtual machines][].

trans-unit.source: Development environment: Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Development environment: Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: [Create a virtual machine for a website with Visual Studio][]
trans-unit.target: [Create a virtual machine for a website with Visual Studio][]

trans-unit.source: [Deploy Azure resources using the Compute, Network, and Storage .NET libraries][]
trans-unit.target: [Deploy Azure resources using the Compute, Network, and Storage .NET libraries][]

trans-unit.source: Operating system and image choices
trans-unit.target: Operating system and image choices

trans-unit.source: Choose an image based on the operating system you want to run.
trans-unit.target: Choose an image based on the operating system you want to run.

trans-unit.source: Azure and its partners offer many images, some of which include applications and tools.
trans-unit.target: Azure and its partners offer many images, some of which include applications and tools.

trans-unit.source: Or, use one of your own images.
trans-unit.target: Or, use one of your own images.

trans-unit.source: Azure images
trans-unit.target: Azure images

trans-unit.source: These instructions show you how to use an Azure image to create a virtual machine that's customized with options for networking, load balancing, and more.
trans-unit.target: These instructions show you how to use an Azure image to create a virtual machine that's customized with options for networking, load balancing, and more.

trans-unit.source: See [How to create a custom virtual machine running Windows][].
trans-unit.target: See [How to create a custom virtual machine running Windows][].

trans-unit.source: Use your own image
trans-unit.target: Use your own image

trans-unit.source: Use an image based on an existing Azure virtual machine by *capturing* that virtual machine, or upload an image of your own, stored in a virtual hard disk (VHD):
trans-unit.target: Use an image based on an existing Azure virtual machine by *capturing* that virtual machine, or upload an image of your own, stored in a virtual hard disk (VHD):

trans-unit.source: [How to capture a Windows virtual machine to use as an image][]
trans-unit.target: [How to capture a Windows virtual machine to use as an image][]

trans-unit.target: [Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure][]
